meanings.definition: The larger of two types of nuclei found in ciliate protozoans, containing multiple copies of the genome.
meanings.sent1: The macronucleus in the ciliate protozoan holds many copies of the genetic material.
meanings.sent2: Under the microscope, the macronucleus of the ciliate is clearly visible.
meanings.sent3: The ciliate threw a tiny party in its macronucleus to celebrate its genetic diversity.
meanings.sent4: Like a library with many books, the macronucleus stores numerous genetic instructions.
meanings.sent5: The scientist marveled at the complexity of the macronucleus structure in the ciliate.

meanings.definition: A prominent, elongated nucleus found in certain types of cells.
meanings.sent1: In the cell, the macronucleus stands out due to its elongated shape.
meanings.sent2: The macronucleus of the cell plays a crucial role in genetic regulation.
meanings.sent3: The macronucleus decided to throw a party for the other organelles in the cell.
meanings.sent4: The macronucleus stretched like a rubber band, controlling the cell's functions.
meanings.sent5: The glowing macronucleus was the heart of the cell, pulsing with life.
